instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message:
Hi everyone , I need help with this equipment, I don't have the schematics or .brd file  , the board get 20.v and 0.87ma  after that goes to 20.3 and 0.17ma 

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1C-xBnPpb-5dS4wQ-x82Zph3cPhGfqTYj/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, without battery.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 13.05v
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.360v
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.358v


coffee was spilled on the keyboard , but the board is clean 
I inspected with a thermal camera and <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> were heated 

thank you very much for the files

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message: Check resistance to ground (ohm scale) at L7210/20.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message:
L7210 = 3.7 ohms to ground
L7220 = 3.7 ohms to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message: Any voltage, or pulse at big coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message: both L7210/20 = when I plug the charger starts at  1.078v  and after few seconds downs to 0.670 and do not change any more

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message:
Drop voltage looks like working board.
Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message: I already checked and yes , it does usb activity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message:
USB macOS pendrive flashing Link LED?
Caps Lock LED reacts?
In such case, you have an working board with video issue.
Check external video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doesn't turn on
threads.message: Thank you very much, the macbook is working, the keyboard was short-circuited due to water damage
